ygData.subject: Re: [archive-crawler] Is java 1.5.0 a prerequisite for running the heritrix gui?
ygData.msgSnippet: ... Yes, now that you mention it. ... I was wondering why it wasn t working, but didn t give it too much mind. Looking at the javac ant task, the documentation

Christian Kohlschuetter wrote:

> On Wednesday 04 May 2005 16:42, stack wrote:
> > This is my fault.
> >
> > The packages uploaded to sourceforge were compiled on my desktop w/
> > 1.5.0.  Let me replace the sourceforge files w/ versions compiled w/
> > 1.4.x.  Should be done w/i the hour.
> >
> > Thanks for reporting the below S�ren.
> >
> > St.Ack
>
> Michael,
>
> shouldn't this behaviour be regarded as a bug?

Yes, now that you mention it.

>
> In Heritrix' project.properties all source/target versions are set to
> "1.4" (however, maven.test.target is missing!). So, the expected 
> behavior for
> jspc would also be to compile just fine under 5.0 as a 1.4 compatible 
> class..
> Unfortunately, these properties are not passed to jspc/jasper...

I was wondering why it wasn't working, but didn't give it too much mind.

Looking at the javac ant task, the documentation is bolded in two places 
only; once for 'source' and then for 'target'.  The bolded text makes 
the same point for both 'source' and 'target': '*Note that the default 
value depends on the JVM that is running Ant. We highly recommend to 
always specify this attribute.*'.

Thanks for figuring what the problem was Christian (Fixed in HEAD).

St.Ack
